page.title: 11ROAD TRANSPORT IN BARR
page.content: Roads in the Barr area are two category-unclassified or"B"category. These roads are not suitable for large vehicles and drivers of such often find themselves in difficulties if they venture along narrow hill-tracks. All vehicles in the area have to pass through the village and quite often a considerable variety can be seen eg.- timber lorries,Land Rovers and other four-wheel-drives,tractors with various trailers,pick-ups used for carrying hay and small numbers of livestock,horse-boxes,cattle-floats transporting animals to market. The only regular bus into and out of the village travels on the"B734"from Girvan,going no further than Barr and returning by the same route.In the winter months the roads are hazardous and villagers more than welcome the snow-plough!
